page.title: 02Sturgate Airport.
page.content: On the 27th June 1985 we went for a visit to Sturgate Airport. It is only a small airport so only 11 people work there, 10 men and 1 woman. The airport was built in 1940 so it is 45 years old. Before it was a private airport it was an American airbase. The day before we went they had a visit from British Petroleum. Lots of companies charter the planes to fly their workers around Britain and Europe. We saw a sign writer. He was painting a sign on a plane.The land aound the airport is owned by farmer Frank Hewitt and he uses it to grow crops. The runway is 850 metres long and 46 metres wide. The planes they had were a 6,8 and 10 seaters. The petrol they use is called Avgas it is 5 star. If a plane has a tank full of Avgas it can fly to Nice in France.
